title: Paul Sinha will quit The Chase if Parkinson's deteriorates quiz skills
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Paul Sinha has revealed he will quit The Chase if he feels his Parkinson’s disease is becoming an obstacle when answering questions.

The 49-year-old confirmed his diagnosis earlier this year just months after announcing his engagement, and during today’s Lorraine ‘The Sinnerman’ admitted the blow came as a ‘massive shock’.

‘But I knew things were going on with my body,’ he told the host.

Regardless, Paul was recently crowned British Quiz Champion, which he described as his ‘Everest’. However, should the day come when he feels like he’s not 100 percent when batting off Bradley Walsh’s questions, he’ll pull out of the ITV series.

‘Hand on heart if I feel like I’m not answering questions like I used to, I will quit,’ he said.

Paul also confirmed he’s about to tie the knot with the love of his life this Christmas, revealing the date of his wedding.

Paul said he’ll quit The Chase if Parkinson’s progresses that far (Picture: ITV)

Paul Sinha opened up about his Parkinson’s diagnosis on Lorraine (Picture: ITV)

‘I was single for 23 years!’ he gasped. ‘I didn’t see this one coming at all. I proposed to my boyfriend Oliver, he said yes. We’re getting married on Dec 14.’

‘This is important,’ he continued. ‘I was told by a friend of mine who has Parkinson’s, and this is the thing when you get diagnosed people come out of the wood work to support you, “Do the things in your life, put them in the diary, things to excite you and I can’t think of anything more exciting than getting married.’

The Chase continues weekdays at 5pm on ITV while Lorraine also airs weekdays at 8.30am on the same channel.
